title.narrative: SOCIAL BEHAVIOR CHANGE COMMUNICATION (SBCC)

description.narrative: By end of 2021, adolescent programming is strengthened and integrated in education, health, nutrition and Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH), child protection through the operationalization of adolescent programming strategy., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Country programme is efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end of 2021, adolescent programming is strengthened and integrated in education, health, nutrition and WASH, child protectionthrough the operationalization of adolescent programming strategy.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to be a leading RCCE partner of the Government of Afghanistan during the COVID-19 pandemic, AWD and measles epidemics. In 2021, UNICEF reached 12,6 million people through mass media, community engagement;and social listening within RCCE and AAP interventions. UNICEF has engaged 47,340 stakeholders via face-to-face community sessions and conducted multimedia campaigns on COVID-19, cholera, education, hygiene measures, protection and nutrition that reached over 24 million people. UNICEF diversified strategies to inform, engage and motivate families, communities and influencers on prevention messages on outbreaks, promote COVID-19 vaccination and essential family practices focused on behaviour change. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/01/2022

C4D strategy for Country Programme meets benchmarks to effectively guide actions of programme implementation and/or upstream programmme/policy advocacy in both sectoral and cross-cutting results in priority areas for normative, social and behaviour change, Text

baseline.value: 1 - No written C4D strategy in place

target.value: 2021:3: 2-3 of the benchmarks for C4D strategy have been incorporated in the strategy and outlines strategies for establishing or strengthening of participatory processes for community and children and adolescent engagement, with special focus on most marginal
